meanings.definition: To gasp for breath, especially after exertion.
meanings.sent1: After running to catch the bus, she peched heavily, trying to catch her breath.
meanings.sent2: The hiker peched as he reached the mountain peak, exhausted from the climb.
meanings.sent3: The puppy peched dramatically after chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The old car peched and sputtered before finally starting up.
meanings.sent5: The swimmer peched desperately as he struggled to stay afloat in the deep water.

meanings.sent1: She peched about having to do her chores before going out to play.
meanings.sent2: The customer peched to the manager about the poor service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: He peched good-naturedly about having to wait in line for his turn.
meanings.sent4: The child peched like a little thundercloud over having to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The student peched quietly to himself about the difficult homework assignment.

meanings.sent1: After running up the stairs, she was peched and had to sit down to rest.
meanings.sent2: The sprinter peched at the finish line, having given his all in the race.
meanings.sent3: The puppy peched after chasing its tail in circles, needing a break.
meanings.sent4: The exhausted runner peched like a steam engine as he crossed the marathon finish line.
meanings.sent5: The child peched after running around the playground, cheeks flushed with exertion.
